page.title: 19RIDING FOR THE DISABLED
page.content: At{Scropton riding school}they have about{27 horses.}They have to be quiet because they have handicapped children that come to the school. The riding school is meant for{handicapped children. There are{four full time {workers}and one on a youth training scheme.They work from 8.00 in a morning until 5.30 at night. When the handicapped children are riding they sometimes need two people per horse, one to lead them and one to hold them on the horse or pony. The riding school was opened on June 23 1978 by Princess Anne. Half of the ponies go out at night, and the rest stay in.The biggest horse in the stables stands at 17.3 hh, and the smallest in the stables is a little Shetland.
